frame.name: Legal_rulings
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Authority</fen> with the power to make decisions hands down a <fen>Finding</fen> over a question presented in a formal or informal <fen>Case</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Authority">The judge</fex> <t>ruled</t> <fex name="Time">yesterday</fex> <fex name="Finding">that the revisions were not adequate</fex>. <fex name="Case">DNI</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="Authority">A high court in London</fex> <t>ruled</t> <fex name="Case">on the case</fex> <fex name="Finding">that a vulture fund can extract more than $20 million from Zambia for a debt</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Case">In the California case</fex>, <fex name="Authority">a judge</fex> <t>ruled</t> <fex name="Time">Oct. 12</fex> <fex name="Finding">that Tendler must pay the bloggers' legal fees</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Authority
FE.definition:
<def-root>The Authority (which may be the jury, judge, magistrate or court) decides on the <fen>Finding</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Authority">The US International Trade Commission</fex> <t>ruled</t> <fex name="Finding">that a 1987 anti-dumping tariff against frozen concentrated orange juice from Brazil could be revoked</fex> <fex name="Case">DNI</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Finding
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the outcome of the <fen>Authority</fen>'s deliberation or consideration.
<ex>Miss Mahmod's father <t>ruled</t> <fex name="Finding">that she would never marry him</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Case
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE describes the question on which the <fen>Authority</fen> gives a <fen>Finding</fen>.
<ex>US Supreme Court <t>ruled</t> <fex name="Case">on flag salutes in public schools</fex> today.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Legal_basis
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the basis in law of a <fen>Finding</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> under which the ruling was reached. </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which the <fen>Authority</fen> acts. </def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the purpose why the <fen>Authority</fen> returns a particular <fen>Finding</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies an action that the <fen>Authority</fen> performs in order to return the verdict.</def-root>

FE.name: Re-encoding
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action within the frame expressed by the Re-encoding, but not necessarily</def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.</def-root>

FE.name: Communicative_force
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the <fen>Communicative_force</fen> or authority with which the ruling event operates (often denoted by words such as "officially," "formally," "technically," etc.). </def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>The amount of time that a <fen>Finding</fen> holds.</def-root>

FE.name: Defendant
FE.definition:
<def-root>The person about whom the <fen>Authority</fen> passes a judgment or <fen>Finding</fen>.
<ex>They held <t>judgment</t> <fex name="D">upon me</fex> as a convicted traitress.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: rule.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: pronounce authoritatively and legally to be the case

lexUnit.name: judge.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to rule authoritatively and legally to be the case

lexUnit.name: decree.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to rule authoritatively and leagally to be the case

lexUnit.name: adjudicate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to judge authoritatively and legally

lexUnit.name: judgment.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a decision ruled upon by a legal authority

lexUnit.name: deem.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to rule upon as a legal authority
